00034 class ImageFormat_TarProxy: public FileFormat
00035 {
00036 private:
00037     struct {
00038         char name[100];
00039         char mode[8];
00040         char uid[8];
00041         char gid[8];
00042         char size[12];
00043         char mtime[12];
00044         char chksum[8];
00045         char typeflag;
00046         char linkname[100];
00047         char magic[6];
00048         char version[2];
00049         char uname[32];
00050         char gname[32];
00051         char devmajor[8];
00052         char devminor[8];
00053         char prefix[155];
00054         char padding[12];
00055     } tar_header;
00056     bool read_header( const boost::iostreams::filtering_istream &src, size_t &size, size_t &next_header_in ) {
00057         if( boost::iostreams::read( src, reinterpret_cast<char *>( &tar_header ), 512 ) == 512 ) {
00058             //get the size
00059             std::stringstream buff( tar_header.size );
00060             size = 0, next_header_in = 0;
00061 
00062             if( tar_header.size[10] != 0 ) {
00063                 buff >> std::oct >> size;
00064                 next_header_in = ( size / 512 ) * 512 + ( size % 512 ? 512 : 0 );
00065             }
00066 
00067             return true;
00068         } else
00069             return false;
00070     }
00071     static size_t tar_readstream( const boost::iostreams::filtering_istream &src, void *dst, size_t size, const std::string &log_title ) {
00072         size_t red = boost::iostreams::read( src, ( char * )dst, size ); // read data from the stream into the mapped memory
00073 
00074         if( red != size ) { // read the data from the stream
00075             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Could not read all " << size << " bytes for " << util::MSubject( log_title );
00076         }
00077 
00078         return red;
00079     }
00080 
00081 protected:
00082     std::string suffixes()const {
00083         return std::string( "tar tar.gz tgz tar.bz2 tbz tar.Z taz" );
00084     }
00085 public:

00094                         ret.insert( dias.begin(), dias.end() );
00095                     }
00096                     return util::listToString( ret.begin(), ret.end(), ",", "", "" );
00097                 }*/
00098     }
00099     std::string getName()const {return "tar decompression proxy for other formats";}
00100 
00101     int load ( std::list<data::Chunk> &chunks, const std::string &filename, const std::string &dialect ) throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00102         int ret = 0;
00103 
00104         const util::istring suffix = makeBasename( filename ).second.c_str();
00105 
00106 
00107         // set up the input stream
00108         std::ifstream input( filename.c_str(), std::ios_base::binary );
00109         input.exceptions( std::ios::badbit );
00110         boost::iostreams::filtering_istream in;
00111 
00112         if( suffix == ".tar.gz" || suffix == ".tgz" )
00113             in.push( boost::iostreams::gzip_decompressor() );
00114         else if( suffix == ".tar.bz2" || suffix == ".tbz" )
00115             in.push( boost::iostreams::bzip2_decompressor() );
00116         else if( suffix == ".tar.Z" || suffix == ".taz" )
00117             in.push( boost::iostreams::zlib_decompressor() );
00118 
00119         in.push( input );
00120 
00121         size_t size, next_header_in;
00122 
00123         while( in.good() && read_header( in, size, next_header_in ) ) { //read the header block
00124 
00125             boost::filesystem::path org_file;
00126 
00127             if( tar_header.typeflag == 'L' ) { // the filename of the next file is to long - so its stored in the next block (following this header)
00128                 char namebuff[size];
00129                 next_header_in -= tar_readstream( in, namebuff, size, "overlong filename for next entry" );
00130                 in.ignore( next_header_in ); // skip the remaining input until the next header
00131                 org_file = boost::filesystem::path( namebuff );
00132                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Got overlong name " << util::MSubject( org_file.file_string() ) << " for next file.";
00133 
00134                 read_header( in, size, next_header_in ); //continue with the next header
00135             } else {
00136                 //get the original filename (use substr, because these fields are not \0-terminated)
00137                 org_file = boost::filesystem::path( std::string( tar_header.prefix ).substr( 0, 155 ) + std::string( tar_header.name ).substr( 0, 100 ) );
00138             }
00139 
00140             if( size == 0 ) //if there is no content skip this entry (there are allways two "empty" blocks at the end of a tar)
00141                 continue;
00142 
00143             if( tar_header.typeflag == AREGTYPE || tar_header.typeflag == REGTYPE ) {
00144 
00145                 data::IOFactory::FileFormatList formats = data::IOFactory::getFileFormatList( org_file.file_string() ); // and get the reading pluging for that
00146 
00147                 if( formats.empty() ) {
00148                     LOG( Runtime, info ) << "Skipping " << org_file << " from " << filename << " because no plugin was found to read it"; // skip if we found none
00149                 } else {
00150                     LOG( Debug, info ) << "Got " << org_file << " from " << filename << " there are " << formats.size() << " plugins which should be able to read it";
00151 
00152                     const std::pair<std::string, std::string> base = formats.front()->makeBasename( org_file.file_string() );//ask any of the plugins for the suffix
00153                     util::TmpFile tmpfile( "", base.second );//create a temporary file with this suffix
00154                     int mfile = open( tmpfile.file_string().c_str(), O_CREAT | O_RDWR, S_IRUSR | S_IWUSR );
00155 
00156                     if( mfile == -1 ) {
00157                         throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Failed to open temporary " ) + tmpfile.file_string() );
00158                     }
00159 
00160                     // set it to the given size - otherwise mmap will be very sad
00161 #ifdef HAVE_FALLOCATE
00162                     const int err = fallocate( mfile, FALLOC_FL_KEEP_SIZE, 0, size ); //fast preallocation using features of ome linux-filesystems
00163 #elif HAVE_POSIX_FALLOCATE
00164                     const int err = posix_fallocate( mfile, 0, size ); // slower posix compatible version
00165 #else
00166                     const int err = ( lseek( mfile, size - 1, SEEK_SET ) == size - 1 && ::write( mfile, " ", 1 ) ) ? 0 : errno; //workaround in case there is no fallocate
00167 #endif
00168 
00169                     if( err ) {
00170                         throwSystemError( err, std::string( "Failed grow " ) + tmpfile.file_string() + " to size " + boost::lexical_cast<std::string>( size ) );
00171                     }
00172 
00173                     char *mmem = ( char * )mmap( NULL, size, PROT_WRITE, MAP_SHARED, mfile, 0 ); //map it into memory
00174 
00175                     if( mmem == MAP_FAILED ) {
00176                         throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Failed to map temporary " ) + tmpfile.file_string() + " into memory" );
00177                     }
00178 
00179                     LOG( Debug, info ) << "Mapped " << size << " bytes of " << tmpfile.file_string() << " at " << ( void * )mmem;
00180 
00181                     size_t red = boost::iostreams::read( in, mmem, size ); // read data from the stream into the mapped memory
00182                     next_header_in -= red;
00183 
00184                     if( red != size ) { // read the data from the stream
00185                         LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Could not read all " << size << " bytes for " << tmpfile.file_string();
00186                     }
00187 
00188                     //unmap and close the file
00189                     munmap( mmem, size );
00190                     close( mfile );
00191 
00192                     // read the temporary file
00193                     std::list<data::Chunk>::iterator prev = chunks.end();
00194                     --prev;
00195                     ret += data::IOFactory::load( chunks, tmpfile.string(), "", dialect );
00196 
00197                     for( ; prev != chunks.end(); ++prev ) { // set the source property of the red chunks to something more usefull
00198                         prev->setPropertyAs( "source", ( boost::filesystem::path( filename ) / org_file ).file_string() );
00199                     }
00200                 }
00201             } else {
00202                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Skipping " << org_file.file_string() << " because its no regular file (type is " << tar_header.typeflag << ")" ;
00203             }
00204 
00205             in.ignore( next_header_in ); // skip the remaining input until the next header
00206         }
00207 
00208         return ret;
00209     }
00210 
00211     void write( const data::Image &image, const std::string &filename, const std::string &dialect )throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00212         throw( std::runtime_error( "Writing to tar is not (yet) implemented" ) );
00213     }
00214     bool tainted()const {return false;}//internal plugins are not tainted
00215 };
00216 }

00218 isis::image_io::FileFormat *factory()
00219 {
00220     return new isis::image_io::ImageFormat_TarProxy();
